captionText: Love is the greatest adventure that one can take.
author: Louise L. Hay

captionText: You are my sun, moon, and all my stars.
author: E. E. Cummings

captionText: In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours.
author: Maya Angelou

captionText: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

captionText: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

captionText: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

captionText: Love is friendship that has caught fire.
author: Ann Landers

captionText: I have died every day waiting for you. Darling, don't be afraid. I have loved you for a thousand years. I'll love you for a thousand more.
author: Christina Perri

captionText: You are my today and all of my tomorrows.
author: Leo Christopher

captionText: If I had a flower for every time I thought of you, I could walk in my garden forever.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

captionText: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan

captionText: Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: I could start fires with what I feel for you.
author: David Ramirez

captionText: Every heart sings a song, incomplete until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

captionText: Love is the flower; you've got to let it grow.
author: John Lennon

captionText: Love is the bridge between you and everything.
author: Rumi

captionText: You are my heart, my life, my one and only thought.
author: Conan Doyle

captionText: A hundred hearts would be too few to carry all my love for you.
author: Unknown

captionText: We loved with a love that was more than love.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

captionText: You have bewitched me, body and soul, and I love, I love, I love you. I never wish to be parted from you from this day on.
author: Jane Austen

captionText: I love you past the moon and miss you beyond the stars.
author: J. M. Storm

captionText: With love and patience, nothing is impossible.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

captionText: For you, a thousand times over.
author: Khaled Hosseini

captionText: I want to spend every moment of my life with you.
author: Unknown

captionText: Every love story is beautiful, but ours is my favorite.
author: Unknown

captionText: My love for you has no depth, its boundaries are ever-expanding.
author: Christina White

captionText: I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.
author: William Blake

captionText: I love you not only for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

captionText: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more, that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return.
author: Moulin Rouge

captionText: You have bewitched me, body and soul, and I love, I love, I love you. I never wish to be parted from you from this day on.
author: Jane Austen

captionText: I swear I couldn't love you more than I do right now, and yet I know I will tomorrow.
author: Leo Christopher

captionText: I love you and that's the beginning and end of everything.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

captionText: To the world, you may be one person, but to one person you may be the world.
author: Unknown

captionText: I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.
author: William Blake

captionText: You had me at hello.
author: Jerry Maguire

captionText: It was love at first sight, at last sight, at ever and ever sight.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

captionText: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
author: Herman Hesse

captionText: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan

captionText: Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: Love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

captionText: In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours.
author: Maya Angelou

captionText: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

captionText: A hundred hearts would be too few to carry all my love for you.
author: Unknown

captionText: I am who I am because of you. You are every reason, every hope, and every dream I've ever had.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: I could start fires with what I feel for you.
author: David Ramirez

captionText: I have died every day waiting for you. Darling, don't be afraid. I have loved you for a thousand years. I'll love you for a thousand more.
author: Christina Perri

captionText: Love is not finding someone to live with. It's finding someone you can't live without.
author: Rafael Ortiz

captionText: We loved with a love that was more than love.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

captionText: I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be.
author: Charles Dickens

captionText: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
author: Robert Frost

captionText: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.
author: Oscar Wilde

captionText: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike

captionText: In your smile, I see something more beautiful than the stars.
author: Unknown

captionText: Love is a game that two can play and both win.
author: Eva Gabor

captionText: I have found the one whom my soul loves.
author: Song of Solomon 3:4

captionText: If you remember me, then I don't care if everyone else forgets.
author: Haruki Murakami

captionText: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul and makes us reach for more, that plants a fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds.
author: Nicholas Sparks

captionText: You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear.
author: Oscar Wilde
